title: The Mists of Manittoo
description: THEY COULD DIE FOR LOVING...BUT THEIR HEARTS WERE UNAFRAIDElizabeth lay bruised and overcome by fever, the red earth of the forest beneath her and the tall, bronzed Indian above. He was Wakwa, standing proud and prince-like in the wind and the rain. He was a thousand years behind the civilization of the English settlers, but her future was with him.From the moment he came upon the frightened young girl who had run away from a cruel betrothal to a Puritan minister, Wakwa was her protector against harm. He would stand beside her against his own people and hers, fearless of the danger. For however great was the suffering their would be made to endure, their love was greater.
author: Lois Swann
